subject: Re: [Read_Alphabet] Re: Reading and Writing Speed
msgSnippet: ... My reading/writing skills in QS aren t that impressive, and besides I have cerebral palsy so my writing speeds aren t comparable to other people s, but I m
messageBody:
On 2013-04-07 23:00, Timothy wrote:
> In my case, it took about six months. I was alone in my endeavor, which likely slowed me down since the only person I was communicating with was my future self. A friend of mine managed to master it in half the time since they used it to chat with me occasionally online.
>
> --- In Read_Alphabet@yahoogroups.com, "stratocat6969" <john-bergsma@...> wrote:
>>
>> Has anyone achieved reading and writing speed with Senior QuickScript approaching what they could do with normal cursive handwriting? If so, how long did it take to get there?

My reading/writing skills in QS aren't that impressive, and
besides I have cerebral palsy so my writing speeds aren't
comparable to other people's, but I'm a shorthand writer
and have about the same reading speed in shorthand and
longhand, which shows that you probably can get good
reading speed in *any* script with (varying amounts of)
practice and more practice. It certainly took less
practice to learn to read QS than shorthand, BTW.
(I'm using Melin's Swedish Shorthand and my own
adaptation of it to English, as well as my adaptation
of QS to Swedish as well as ordinary English QS.)

/bpj
